reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?
reply.analysis: The app declares the collection of data in its Privacy Policy document.
reply.reference: This Privacy Policy may be updated from time-to-time at our sole discretion. You can determine when this Privacy Policy was last updated by referring to the 'Last Updated' date at the top of this page. Please note that this Privacy Policy only applies to the processing of personal data carried out by LUCID as a data controller. URL: https://www.thelucidproject.ca/privacy-policy

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects Unique User ID, Email Address, Age, Gender identity, Baseline profile survey data (STOMP, STAI-Trait, Big 5 Personality Trait), Biometric data acquired through wearable devices, Emotional and cognitive self-assessment data including Arousal / Valence Grid, SUDS (Subjective Units of Discomfort) - Anxiety, POMS (Profile of mood states).

content: Baseline profile survey data (STOMP, STAI-Trait, Big 5 Personality Trait)
Biometric data acquired through wearable devices
Emotional and cognitive self-assessment data including Arousal / Valence Grid

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions the types of data collected by the app, ranging from user identification information to emotional and cognitive self-assessment data.
reply.reference: The app collects Unique User ID, Email Address, Age, Gender identity, Baseline profile survey data (STOMP, STAI-Trait, Big 5 Personality Trait), Biometric data acquired through wearable devices, Emotional and cognitive self-assessment data including Arousal / Valence Grid, SUDS (Subjective Units of Discomfort) - Anxiety, POMS (Profile of mood states).; URL: https://www.thelucidproject.ca/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use by utilizing music and psychoacoustics to help users manage their personal mental wellbeing. It collects user self-assessment scores and biometric data to provide personalized music interventions and better user experiences.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app focuses on using music and psychoacoustics to aid users in managing their mental wellbeing and describes how user self-assessment scores and biometric data are collected and used to personalize music interventions and enhance user experiences.
reply.reference: VIBE hosts a number of features but the core of the product is to use music and psychoacoustics to help users manage their personal mental wellbeing. Each time Users log in to the VIBE App and selects one of our core music interventions...these results enable our machine learning algorithm to provide users with curated music personalized for their mental state and optimized to reach their goal state. As an additional option, biometric data acquired through wearable devices can be used for additional measurements to improve the accuracy of the machine learning system. URL: https://www.thelucidproject.ca/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that users have the right to withdraw their consent, update information, erase data from the system, and object to data collection, use, and disclosure. This provides users with the ability to opt out of data collection or delete their data.
reply.reference: You have the right to withdraw consent at any time. Withdrawing your consent may result in less access to our Services. The withdrawal of consent does not affect the collection, use, and disclosure of the personal information prior to the request for withdrawal. URL: https://www.thelucidproject.ca/privacy-policy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app may share personal information with third parties outside LUCID's organization under specific circumstances such as required by law or with explicit user consent.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app may share personal information with third parties outside their organization under certain conditions.
reply.reference: We do not share personal information with third parties outside of our organization unless one of the following circumstances applies: FOR RELEASE REQUIRED BY LAW We may process and transfer personal information and any other information available to us in order to investigate, prevent or take action regarding illegal activities, or as otherwise required by law. Where possible, we will inform Users about such transfer and processing. WITH YOUR EXPLICIT CONSENT We may share personal information with third parties outside LUCID’s organization for other reasons than the ones mentioned before, when we have the User’s explicit consent to do so. The User has the right to withdraw this consent at all times. ANONYMIZED DATA We may disclose aggregated information that does not include personal information and we may disclose non-identifying information and Log Data to third parties for industry analysis and consultation. Any information or Log Data shared in these contexts will not contain personal user information (only anonymized health data). The limitations and requirements in this Privacy Policy concerning personal information do not apply to non-identifying Information. NO RELEASE FOR MARKETING PURPOSES LUCID will not share, sell, rent, trade, or disclose personal information to any third party for marketing or commercial purposes, unless you have granted us permission in writing to do so. URL: https://www.thelucidproject.ca/privacy-policy

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with third parties outside LUCID's organization with the User's explicit consent.

extended_simple_answer.content: third parties outside LUCID's organization with the User's explicit consent

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app shares data with third parties outside the organization only with the User's explicit consent, ensuring transparency and user control over their data sharing.
